conbody.p: The DS Navigator view pane is located at the top-left corner of the interface. This view pane provides a hierarchical view of your Design Studio (DS) projects, folders, and files. A project is a container that is used to group associated folders and files. All information related to a project is saved and stored in its relevant folders and files. When you create a new DS project, the project and its folders are automatically added to the DS Navigator view pane. You can expand or collapse projects and folders to make it easier to access the information. When you open an existing DS project in the DS Navigator view pane, the DS Workbench interface automatically populates with information related to the project.

The DS Navigator view pane might contain the following icons:
Icon Description
Collapses the nodes of the project or folder.
Keeps the DS Navigator in sync with the open editor.
Show / Hide dependent project.
Tip To enlarge the DS Navigator view pane, use the divider bars to resize the area.
